title: Distribution of gross domestic product ( GDP ) across economic sectors Germany 2018
summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 3 lines namely Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis represents Share of GDP and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Agriculture, Industry, and Services are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Services, 2. Industry, and lastly, 3. Agriculture.
Throughout the period, Services generally had the highest Share of GDP relative to others with an average of 62.2, and it reached its maximum at 2009 with a value of 64.23.
After Services, Industry overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 26.9, peaking at 2016.
The botommost line, Agriculture,  has a mean of 0.81, and peaked at 2013.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis indicates the Share of GDP and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Agriculture, Industry, and Services are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Share of GDP in descending order is: 1. Services, 2. Industry, and lastly, 3. Agriculture.
Overall across the Year, Services mostly maintained the highest Share of GDP when compared to others with a mean value of 62.2, and it peaked at 2009.
After Services, Industry overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 26.9, peaking at 2016.
The botommost line, Agriculture,  has a mean of 0.81, and peaked at 2013.
The minimum Share of GDP about 0.68, occured at 2015 by Agriculture.
